revised_title: Meteorological Observations and Phenomena in Somersetshire and Cornwall in 1768
tldr: This article presents meteorological observations and phenomena recorded in Somersetshire and Cornwall in 1768. The author, Dr. Jeremiah Milles, and co-author William Borlase, provide detailed records of temperature, barometer readings, wind patterns, and precipitation. Notable events include a strong Aurora Borealis and a deep snowfall in Bridgwater, while Ludgvan experienced a constant, uncommon lightning event.
